revision.comment: Robot - Moving category 21st-century movements to [[:Category:21st-century social movements]] per [[WP:CFD|CFD]] at [[Wikipedia:Categories for discussion/Log/2018 August 5]].
revision.text:
{{Infobox Union |name= Planka.nu |country= [[Sweden]] |affiliation= |members= |full_name= |native_name= Planka.nu |image= [[Image:Hoppagubben.gif|150px]] |founded= 2001 |current= |head= |dissolved_date= |dissolved_state= |merged_into= |office= |people= |website= [http://planka.nu planka.nu] |footnotes= }}
'''Planka.nu''' is a network of organizations in [[Sweden]] and [[Norway]] promoting [[tax]]-financed [[zero-fare public transport]] with chapters in [[Stockholm]], [[Gothenburg]], [[Skåne]], [[Östergötland]] and [[Oslo]].<ref name="planka-om">{{cite web | url = http://planka.nu/om-plankanu | title = Om Planka.nu | work = Planka.nu | accessdate = 2010-01-25 | quote = }}</ref> Planka.nu was founded in 2001 by the [[Swedish Anarcho-syndicalist Youth Federation]] in response to the increasingly expensive ticket prices in the [[Public transport in Stockholm|public transport system in Stockholm]]. The campaign has received much attention because of the controversial methods used to promote free [[public transport]]: Planka.nu encourage people to [[Fare dodging|fare-dodge]] in the public transport,<ref name="fpt">{{cite web | url = http://www.freepublictransports.com/Planka.nu | title = Planka.nu | work = Free Public Transport | accessdate = 2010-01-25 | quote = }}</ref> <ref name="planka-darfor">{{cite web | url = http://planka.nu/vad-tycker-vi/darfor-vagrar-vi-betala | title = Avgiftsstrejk | work = Planka.nu | accessdate = 2010-01-25 | quote = }}</ref> aiding its members in paying [[penalty fare]]s through the insurance fund ''p-kassan''.<ref name="planka-pkassan">{{cite web | url = http://planka.nu/plankning/stockholm/pkassan | title = P-kassan är en bötesfond för plankare i Stockholms kollektivtrafik | work = Planka.nu | accessdate = 2010-01-24 | quote = P-kassan är en solidaritetskassa. Som medlem hjälper du andra plankare att få sina böter betalda. När du själv åker fast är det andra plankare som betalar din tilläggsavgift. }}</ref>
== History == In 2001, the Stockholm chapter of the Swedish Anarcho-syndicalist Youth Federation ({{lang-sv|SUF, Syndikalistiska Ungdomsförbundet}}) launched the campaign Planka.nu (literally, ''fare-dodge.now'') as a reaction to a rise in ticket prices by the [[Stockholm County Council]].<ref name="planka-om"/> The domain name [[.nu]], which belongs to the {{convert|260|km²|adj=on}} island of [[Niue]] but is sold primarily to foreigners, was chosen because it means "now" in [[Swedish language|Swedish]]. The standard [[top level domain]] for Sweden is [[.se]].
With growing membership and interest, the campaign was detached from the SUF to form an independent organization. Local organizations have since started up in [[Gothenburg]] in 2003, [[Östergötland]] in 2005 and [[Skåne]] in 2009.<ref name=planka-om /> A sister organization, ''pumm.it'' has been created in [[Helsinki]], [[Finland]].<ref name="pummit">{{cite web |url = http://planka.nu/pummit |title = Pummit - moi mukulat |work = Planka.nu |accessdate = 2010-01-26 |quote = |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20100813125840/http://planka.nu/pummit |archivedate = 2010-08-13 |df = }}</ref> In November 2008, Planka.nu released [http://freepublictransports.com Freepublictransports.com], a global forum for the free public transport movement.
Ticket fares in Stockholm have increased dramatically over time. By one measure—single ticket price for a {{convert|10|km|adj=on}} journey—Stockholm has the most expensive-to-use public transport in the world, as of March 2009.<ref>{{cite web| url=http://www.economist.com/displayStory.cfm?story_id=14396066 |title=A fare price?| publisher=[[The Economist]]| date=September 24, 2009| accessdate=2009-09-24| quote=In Stockholm it costs $4.88 for a single journey of 10km on public transport, the highest cost in a study of 73 cities by [[UBS AG|UBS]], a Swiss bank.}}</ref>
== Activism == [[File:COP15Plankanu.jpg|thumb|250px|Planka.nu demonstrating at the [[COP15]].]] In the tradition of the [[Italians|Italian]] [[autonomist]]s,<ref name="indymedia">{{cite web| url =http://sweden.indymedia.org/newswire/display_any/20075| title =Planka.nu och autoreduktion| first =| last =SAM| date =2002-04-20| month =| year =| work =IMC Sverige| publisher =[[Indymedia]]| accessdate =2010-01-25| quote =| deadurl =yes| archiveurl =https://archive.is/20130415012936/http://sweden.indymedia.org/newswire/display_any/20075| archivedate =2013-04-15| df =}}</ref> Planka.nu advocate [[self-reduction]], where the price of the [[Service (economics)|service]] is determined by the [[consumer]].<ref name="planka-sjalvreduktion">{{cite web | url = http://planka.nu/vad-tycker-vi/sjalvreduktion | title = Självreduktion | work = Planka.nu | accessdate = 2010-01-25 | quote = }}</ref> Whereas in other cases this is done in agreement with (at least some) [[employee]]s of the [[service provider]], in the case of Planka.nu fare-dodgers are encouraged to evade fares without seeking permission.
Since its conception Planka.nu has broadened its methods and now functions as a [[think tank]] with public transport, [[urban planning]] and [[Global warming|climate change]] as its main areas of focus,<ref name=fpt /><ref name="fpt-annual09">{{cite web | url = http://www.freepublictransports.com/blog/2010/01/annual-report-from-planka-nu-stockholm-sweden/ | title = Annual report from Planka.nu (Stockholm, Sweden) | work = Free Public Transport | accessdate = 2010-02-01 | quote = }}</ref> as well as an insurance fund. The network also uses standard [[leftist]] methods, such as [[Demonstration (people)|rallies]],<ref name="fpt-annual08">{{cite web | url = http://www.freepublictransports.com/blog/2009/05/annual-report-for-2008-from-plankanu-stockholm-sweden/ | title = Annual report for 2008 from Planka.nu (Stockholm, Sweden) | work = Free Public Transport | accessdate = 2010-02-01 | quote = }}</ref> [[adbusting]],<ref name=fpt-annual09 /> and [[pamphlet]]s.<ref name="planka-information">{{cite web |url = http://planka.nu/engagera-dig/informationsmaterial |title = Informationsmaterial |work = Planka.nu |accessdate = 2010-02-01 |quote = |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20100302014519/http://www.planka.nu/engagera-dig/informationsmaterial |archivedate = 2010-03-02 |df = }}</ref> Together with refugee rights organization [http://ingenillegal.org/introduction Ingen människa är illegal], the Swedish chapter of [[No one is illegal]], Planka.nu provides tickets for [[immigrant]]s living in Sweden without [[right to asylum|asylum]],<ref name=planka-ekonomi /> since a [[Illegal immigration|paperless immigrant]] might otherwise be reported to the police and deported if caught riding without a ticket.
=== P-kassan === Failing to purchase a ticket or traveling using an incorrect pass is subject to a [[penalty fare]] of 1200 [[Swedish krona|SEK]] in the public transport systems of Stockholm,<ref>{{cite web|title=Om du fuskåker|publisher=AB Storstockholms Lokaltrafik|url=http://sl.se/Resenar/Resegaranti-resevillkor/Resa-utan-eller-med-fel-biljett/|accessdate=2010-10-17|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100824205024/https://sl.se/Resenar/Resegaranti-resevillkor/Resa-utan-eller-med-fel-biljett/|archivedate=2010-08-24|df=}}</ref> Gothenburg<ref>{{cite web|title=Biljettkontroll|publisher=Västtrafik|url=http://www.vasttrafik.se/sv/Att-resa/Biljettkontroll/|accessdate=2010-01-26}}</ref> and Östergötland.<ref>{{cite web|title=Du har väl giltig biljett?|publisher=ÖstgötaTrafiken|url=http://www.ostgotatrafiken.se/templates/WidePage____9645.aspx|accessdate=2010-01-26|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080121202301/http://www.ostgotatrafiken.se/templates/WidePage____9645.aspx|archivedate=2008-01-21|df=}}</ref> In return for a membership fee (paid monthly or biannually) members are refunded by Planka.nu if fined, through the solidarity fund ''P-kassan''.<ref name=planka-pkassan /> Net income from p-kassan is used in the aforementioned partnership with ''No one is illegal'' and to finance the production of flyers, stickers, folders, web pages and other information material. All members of Planka.nu work [[pro-bono]].<ref name="planka-ekonomi">{{cite web | url = http://planka.nu/om-plankanu/ekonomi | title = Ekonomi | work = Planka.nu | accessdate = 2010-10-17 | quote = }}</ref><ref name="tv4-cliffordson">{{Citation |last = Cliffordson |first = Ida |date = 2010-01-20 |title = Planka.nu anmäls till skatteverket |edition = |series = TV4Nyheterna Göteborg |place = |publication-place = |publisher = [[TV4 (Sweden)|TV4]] |url = http://www.tv4play.se/nyheter/lokala_nyheter/goteborg?videoId=1.1452297 |deadurl = yes |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20120302091524/http://www.tv4play.se/nyheter/lokala_nyheter/goteborg?videoId=1.1452297 |archivedate = 2012-03-02 |df = }}</ref>
In December 2009, [[Västtrafik]] accused the Gothenburg chapter of operating an unauthorized insurance.<ref name=tv4-cliffordson /><ref name="gp-nystrom">{{cite web | url = http://www.gp.se/nyheter/goteborg/1.264921-vasttrafik-vill-stoppa-planka-nu | title = Västtrafik vill stoppa planka.nu | first = Ulf | last = Nyström | date = 2009-12-04 | month = | year = | work = GP.se | publisher = | accessdate = 2010-01-24 | quote = Organisationen planka.nu bedriver försäkringsverksamhet, säger Johnny Bröndt (M), vice ordförande i Västtrafiks styrelse. […] Så vet jag vet har planka.nu varken tillstånd till försäkringsverksamhet eller deklarerar intäkter, utgifter och eventuellt överskott. Det är inte längre någon ideell organisation.}}</ref>
== Criticism == {{see also|Free public transport#Criticism}} Planka.nu and its organizers have seen substantial criticism, primarily by politicians and transportation companies in each city. The network has been reported to the police for [[incitement]] by [[Storstockholms Lokaltrafik]] (SL),<ref name="dn-hermele">{{cite web | url = http://www.dn.se/sthlm/sl-polisanmaler-plankanu-1.299698 | title = SL polisanmäler Planka.nu | first = Bernt | last = Hermele | date = 2004-08-21 | month = | year = | work = DN.se | publisher = | accessdate = 2010-01-25 | quote = }}</ref> Västtrafik and ÖstgötaTrafiken, who believe that Planka.nu engages in illegal activities. As of today, no charges have been made. Planka.nu themselves believe that their activities do not conflict with existing legislation.<ref name="planka-lagligt">{{cite web | url = http://planka.nu/kto/lagligt | title = Lagligt? | work = Planka.nu | accessdate = 2010-01-26 | quote = }}</ref>
Many critics believe that [[fare evasion]] leads to reduced funds and higher costs for public transport, which must be offset by higher prices for those who do pay their fares.<ref name=gp-nystrom /><ref name="dn-palmgren">{{citation | last = Palmgren | first = Nils | title = Skärpt strid om fuskåkning | date = 2004-05-27 | month = | year = | work = [[Dagens Nyheter]] | publisher = | quote = 200 miljoner kronor om året kostar fuskåkandet SL varje år. Enligt företaget gör det månadskortet 50 kronor dyrare än vad det skulle behöva vara.}}</ref>
In 2004, the [[Stockholm University#Student unions|Stockholm University Student Union]] received media attention after first permitting a meeting of the network on its premises and later barring Planka.nu when criticism was voiced.<ref name="dn-kihlstrom">{{cite web | url = http://www.dn.se/sthlm/plankanu-vallar-spricka-i-studentkar-1.319281 | title = Planka.nu vållar spricka i studentkår | first = Staffan | last = Kihlström | date = 2004-10-23 | month = | year = | work = DN.se | publisher = | accessdate = 2010-01-25 | quote = }}</ref>
== Publications == Planka.nu has released four larger [[White paper|policy papers]]: ''Highway to Hell?'' criticizing the plans for the express [[beltway]] [[Förbifart Stockholm]] around [[Stockholm]],<ref name="highwaypdf">{{Citation |title = Highway to Hell? |url = http://planka.nu/reports/plankanu_highway_to_hell.pdf |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20100813125420/http://planka.nu/reports/plankanu_highway_to_hell.pdf |archivedate = 2010-08-13 |format = |accessdate = 2010-01-25 |date = November 2007 |publisher = Planka.nu |language = Swedish |deadurl = yes |df = }}</ref> ''Travel Doesn't Have to Cost the Earth'' proposing a set of measures to make the transport sector in Stockholm more [[Economics of global warming#Mitigation|climate-friendly]],<ref name="travelpdf">{{Citation |title = Travel Doesn't Have to Cost the Earth |url = http://planka.nu/reports/planka_stockholm_report.pdf |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20091229175958/http://planka.nu/reports/planka_stockholm_report.pdf |archivedate = 2009-12-29 |format = |accessdate = 2010-01-25 |date = 2009-09-22 |origyear = 2008 |publisher = Planka.nu |deadurl = yes |df = }}</ref> ''Till varje pris?'' (''At any cost?'') a report about the costs of ticketing in the public transport system in Stockholm,<ref name="tillvarjepdf">{{Citation |title = Till varje pris? |url = http://planka.nu/reports/plankanu_till_varje_pris.pdf |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20100812215850/http://planka.nu/reports/plankanu_till_varje_pris.pdf |archivedate = 2010-08-12 |format = |accessdate = 2010-01-25 |date = March 2009 |publisher = Planka.nu |language = Swedish |deadurl = yes |df = }}</ref> and ''Trafikmaktsordningen'' (''The Trafic Power Structure'') regarding the [[hierarchy|hierarchies]] of [[transportation]] and how it relates to [[social mobility]] and [[social class|class]].<ref name="trafikmaktpdf">{{Citation |title = Trafikmaktsordningen |url = http://planka.nu/reports/plankanu_trafikmaktsordningen.pdf |archiveurl = https://web.archive.org/web/20091222033223/http://planka.nu/reports/plankanu_trafikmaktsordningen.pdf |archivedate = 2009-12-22 |format = |accessdate = 2010-01-25 |date = December 2009 |publisher = Planka.nu |language = Swedish |deadurl = yes |df = }}</ref>
== See also == *[[Ticket barrier]] *[[Stockholm Metro]] *[[Gothenburg tram]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox person | image = | imagesize = | name = Ralph Scotoni | birth_date = 1901 | birth_place = [[Zurich]], [[Switzerland]] | death_date = 1955 | death_place = [[Trieste]], [[Italy]] | othername = | occupation = [[Businessman]]
[[Film producer]] | yearsactive = }} '''Ralph Scotoni''' (1901-1955) was a Swiss [[businessman]] notable for his involvement in the [[Cinema of Germany|German film industry]]. He was the son of [[Eugen Scotoni]]. Between 1930 and 1935, when it was [[nationalisation|nationalised]] by the German government, he oversaw his family's interest in [[Terra Film]] - the second most important German production company behind [[Universum Film AG|UFA]]. Scotoni automatically became a member of the Nazi Party (as was common for owners of large companies) but never picked up his membership card. Many of his later films depicted similarities between [[Switzerland]] and [[Nazi Germany]]. He left Germany in 1935 after the nationalization of Terra. ==Selected filmography== * ''[[The Man Who Murdered]]'' (1931) * ''[[William Tell (1934 film)|William Tell]]'' (1934) * ''[[The Champion of Pontresina]]'' (1934) ==Bibliography== * Killy, Wather. ''Dictionary of German Biography, Volume 9''. Walter de Gruyter, 2005. ==External links== *{{IMDb name|2282226}} {{Authority control}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Scotoni, Ralph}} [[Category:1901 births]] [[Category:1955 deaths]] [[Category:People from Zürich]] [[Category:Nazi Party members]] [[Category:Swiss film producers]] [[Category:Swiss businesspeople]] {{Switzerland-business-bio-stub}}

{{Use dmy dates|date=May 2011}} {{Infobox Organization |name = SANZAAR |image = SANZAAR logo.svg |size = 200px |abbreviation = |motto = |type = {{nowrap|[[List of international sport federations|International sport federation]]}} |formation = {{Start date and age|1996}} |headquarters = [[Sydney]], Australia |coords = {{Coord|33|53|28|S|151|15|00|E|region:AU_type:landmark}} |region_served = |membership = |leader_title = CEO |leader_name = [[Andy Marinos]] |leader_title2= |leader_name2 = |affiliations = |website= [http://www.sanzarrugby.com sanzarrugby.com] |}}
'''SANZAAR''' (South Africa, New Zealand, Australia and Argentina Rugby) is the body which operates [[Super Rugby]] and [[The Rugby Championship]] competitions in [[Rugby Union]]. SANZAAR meets annually and is composed of the CEOs from its member unions.
It was formed as SANZAR in 1996 as a joint venture of the [[South African Rugby Union]], the [[New Zealand Rugby Union]] and the [[Australian Rugby Union]]. From the 2016 season, its name was changed to SANZAAR following the inclusion of the [[Argentine Rugby Union]] as a full member of the organisation.<ref name="SANZAR changes name to SANZAAR">{{cite web | url=http://www.sport24.co.za/Rugby/sanzar-changes-name-to-sanzaar-20160202 | title=SANZAR changes name to SANZAAR | work=Sport24 | date=2 February 2016 | accessdate=2 February 2016}}</ref>
{{toc level|3}}
== History == === Tri-Nations and Super 12: 1996 === [[File:SANZAR logo old.svg|150px|thumb|left|{{nowrap|SANZAR logo up to 2015.}}]]
SANZAR was formed in 1995, shortly after rugby's move to professionalism, to counter the threat of Australia's [[Super League (Australia)|Super League]], a new [[rugby league]] competition that offered large salaries to players.<ref>{{cite book|last=Howitt|first=Bob |year=2005| title=SANZAR Saga: Ten Years of Super 12 and Tri-Nations Rugby| publisher=Harper Collins Publishers |ISBN=1-86950-566-2}}</ref>
SANZAR proposed the [[Super Rugby|Super 12]], an annual provincial competition with teams from all three countries, and the [[The Rugby Championship|Tri Nations Series]], an annual competition between each country's Test teams. This concept was developed by [[Queensland Rugby Union]] [[Chief executive officer|CEO]] Terry Doyle, [[New South Wales Rugby Union]] CEO [[David Moffett]] and [[Australian Rugby Union]] CEO Bruce Hayman.<ref name = smh-2002/> [[Rian Oberholzer]] was the first CEO of SANZAR.
SANZAR's proposals were under serious threat from the World Rugby Corporation (WRC), a company formed by lawyer Geoff Levy and former Wallaby player Ross Turnbull. Both wanted a professional worldwide rugby competition funded by [[Kerry Packer]], who had already developed professional cricket. At one point the WRC had a majority of the All Blacks and Wallaby teams signed up to their competition. However, the South African Rugby Union told the Springboks players that they would never play for their country again if they committed to the WRC, and they remained with the SARU. Most of the All Blacks then followed them, and finally the Wallabies did too.
To fund the competitions, SANZAR looked to [[News Limited]], who was the Super League's broadcaster, eventually being offered $555 million over 10 years for worldwide television rights.
{{clear}}
=== Expansion to Super 14 ===
In 2002, a proposal to expand the Super 12 to fourteen teams, supported by Australia and South Africa, was vetoed by the [[New Zealand Rugby Union]].<ref name = espn-19-02-2002/> This led to calls for the Australian and South African teams to withdraw from the competition,<ref name = espn-19-02-2002/><ref name = espn-21-02-2002/> but the partnership continued and the issue was revisited before the end of the original 10-year broadcasting deal.
For the 2006 season, SANZAR agreed to expand the Super 12 competition with two new teams and to increase the number of Test matches played in the Tri-Nations.<ref name = espn-6-9-2004/> Licences were granted for franchises based in Bloemfontein and Perth,<ref name= cheetahs/><ref name = espn-10-12-2004/> creating the [[Cheetahs (rugby union)|Cheetahs]] and [[Western Force]] teams for the expanded Super 14 competition.
The SANZAR partnership was tested in 2007 after New Zealand removed its top 22 players from the Super 14 competition,<ref name = smh-2007/> and South Africa's removal of players from the Tri-Nations prompted calls for the [[Australian Rugby Union]] to cancel future matches against the Springboks.<ref name = aus-2007/>
==== Potential South African departure ==== In 2009 there emerged concerns that [[South African Rugby Union]] might opt to break away from the alliance over a dispute about the proposed plan to expand [[Super Rugby]] to fifteen teams in 2011, voicing its support for the concept generally but disagreeing over its length and format. On 6 May 2009, however, ARU Chief Executive [[John O'Neill (sport administrator)|John O'Neill]] warned that the South Africans would be the real losers, missing out altogether and potentially losing players if they went ahead with the split. "The joint venture must remain intact", he urged. "I have dealt with the South Africans for years in [[business]] and [[sport]]. Part of their [[DNA]] is to take it to the brink. There's a moment when they will realise they have taken it far enough."<ref name= reuters-2009/> On 20 May 2009, SANZAR announced it had reached agreement on a new deal involving all three nations beginning in the 2011 season.<ref name= deal-2009/>
=== The Rugby Championship and Super Rugby: 2011 === The deal for 2011 to 2015 included:<ref name= deal-2009/> * Super Rugby expanded to 15 teams, and split into three conferences, each with five teams and based in one of the three nations. The four current Australian teams would be joined by a new team in the Australia conference; this license was later awarded to the [[Melbourne Rebels]]. * At the same time, the regular season expanded to include 16 matches (8 home, 8 away) per team, with each country playing a double round-robin within its home conference, and playing single matches against four teams from each of the other conferences. * Super Rugby taking three weeks off in June for the mid-year Tests. * The play-offs expanded to six teams, with the conference winners joined by the three non-winners with the most competition points without regard to conference affiliation. The two conference winners with the most competition points received a first-round bye in the play-offs. * [[The Rugby Championship]] opening each year in South Africa, and concluding with the two of the three [[Bledisloe Cup]] matches between Australia and New Zealand that fall within the Rugby Championship. This allowed Springboks to be released early for their domestic competition, the [[Currie Cup]].
=== Super Rugby to Argentina and Japan: 2016 === Further expansion was agreed in 2015 to include the [[Argentine Rugby Union]] as a full member of SANZAAR from 2016.<ref name = nyt-2015/> Three additional teams were included in the Super Rugby competition, one each from South Africa, Argentina and Japan. Two regional groupings were formed: the Australasian Group, with five teams in the Australian Conference and five teams in the New Zealand Conference and the South African Group, with six South African teams, one Argentinean team and one Japanese team split into a four-team Africa 1 Conference a four-team Africa 2 Conference.<ref name="Outline of the Super Rugby competition structure">{{cite web | url=http://files.allblacks.com/comms/new-era-super-rugby/Outline-%20Super-Rugby-Comp-Structure-infographic.pdf | title=Outline of the Super Rugby competition structure | publisher=All Blacks | date=1 May 2014 | accessdate=1 May 2014}}</ref>
While a Japanese team has been invited to participate in the [[Super Rugby]] competition from 2016, Japan is not a member of SANZAAR at this stage.
== See also == *[[Super Rugby]] *[[The Rugby Championship]]

{{EngvarB|date=January 2018}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2018}} '''Sean Patrick Ewing''' (age 51) is an Irish entrepreneur involved in the fund management and yachting industries. He established [[FundsDirect]] in 1999 and co-founded [[Absolute Capital Management]] in 2004. In 2009 he acquired a majority stake in Pinmar, the world's largest yacht painting company, from the [[Ferretti Group]]. His wealth has been estimated at '''[[Euro sign|€]]'''95m and he has featured on the ''[[Irish Independent]]'s'' Irish Rich List since 2010.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/irelands-rich-list-251275-26645366.html|title=Ireland's Rich List: 251–275 – Independent.ie|newspaper=The Irish Independent|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/irish/rich-list-2015/profiles/sean-ewing-31046194.html|title=Sean Ewing – Independent.ie|newspaper=The Irish Independent|access-date=4 November 2016}}</ref>
==Early life and career== Ewing, a native of [[Donegal]], was born the Irish seaport of Sligo in 1965 and attended [[Summerhill College]]. On leaving school, Ewing worked for his uncle's small engineering business in Letterkenny while studying accountancy at the [[Ulster University|University of Ulster]]. He was invited to run the investment arm of an Irish building society, developing its tax planning, financial planning and portfolio management services. This led to an opportunity to partner with Hichens, Harrison & Co, the oldest firm of stockbrokers in the [[City of London Corporation|City of London]], to acquire IPS Capital Management, the Bristol-based fund management business.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/interview-of-the-week-real-life-jr-is-a-mover-and-shaker-in-hedge-fund-world-26295741.html|title=Interview of the Week: Real life 'JR' is a mover and shaker in hedge fund world – Independent.ie|newspaper=The Irish Independent|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref>
== Fund Management == IPS Capital Management was reversed into Farlake, a property company listed on [[AIM market|London Stock Exchange's AIM market]]. Following the reversal, Farlake was repositioned as an asset management company which grew to $1bn assets under management before being sold to Talisman Group in 2000.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.investegate.co.uk/article.aspx?id=200002280701522739G|title=FE Investegate {{!}}Farlake Group PLC Announcements {{!}} Farlake Group PLC: Recommended Offer by Talisman House|website=www.investegate.co.uk|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref>
Ewing carved out from that sale the fund trading business which he had launched in 1999, called FundsDirect, the UK's first online fund supermarket. The platform allowed banks to trade around 36,000 funds across 13 European countries. In 2003 FundsDirect was sold to [[Egg Banking|Egg]] and [[Prudential plc|The Prudential]] for '''[[Euro sign|€]]'''32m.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.independent.ie/business/interview-of-the-week-real-life-jr-is-a-mover-and-shaker-in-hedge-fund-world-26295741.html|title=Interview of the Week: Real life 'JR' is a mover and shaker in hedge fund world – Independent.ie|newspaper=The Irish Independent|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref>
In 2004, Ewing co-founded Absolute Capital Management and listed 30% of the company on [[Alternative Investment Market|AIM]] in 2005. The company won several accolades including European Hedge Fund of the Year in 2006.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.investegate.co.uk/article.aspx?id=200607031247575643F|title=FE Investegate {{!}}Absolute Capital Man Announcements {{!}} Absolute Capital Man: Best Hedge Fund Group 2006|website=www.investegate.co.uk|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref> Ewing retired from Absolute Capital in July 2007 to spend more time with his wife and two young daughters.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.investegate.co.uk/absolute-capital-man--acmh-/rns/interim-results---correction/200707251030338154A/|title=FE Investegate {{!}}Absolute Capital Man Announcements {{!}} Absolute Capital Man: Interim Results – Correction|website=www.investegate.co.uk|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.ft.com/content/c744be7c-3b27-11dc-8f9e-0000779fd2ac|title=Ewing steps down at ACM|last=Spikes|first=Sarah|date=26 July 2007|newspaper=Financial Times|issn=0307-1766|access-date=4 November 2016}}</ref>
In 2016 the US Department of Justice entered a Settlement with Ewing as part of its investigation into Florian Homm, the Chief Investment Officer of Absolute Capital.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.thetimes.co.uk/article/former-absolute-chief-forfeits-7m-l0tt0q7pl|title=Former Absolute chief forfeits €7m|access-date=4 November 2016}}</ref> The settlement acknowledged that Ewing had not undertaken any criminal wrongdoing nor had any knowledge of the alleged stock manipulation scheme that Homm had masterminded and for which Homm was indicted and charged by the US authorities.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.justice.gov/usao-cdca/pr/former-ceo-investment-firm-main-office-spain-pay-8-million-part-agreement-resolve|title=Former CEO of Investment Firm with Main Office in Spain to Pay $8 Million as Part of Agreement to Resolve Criminal Allegations|website=justice.gov|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.sec.gov/news/press/2011/2011-51.htm|title=SEC Charges Securities Professionals and Traders in International Hedge Fund Portfolio Pumping Scheme|website=sec.gov|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref> In July 2017, all charges against Ewing relating to the Homm case were dismissed with prejudice.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.maglaw.com/news/releases/2017-07-11-press-release/_res/id=Attachments/index=0/43%20-%20Order%20Granting%20Motion%20to%20Dismiss%20Information%20with%20Prejudice.pdf|title=Order granting motion to dismiss information with prejudice|date=17 July 2017|website=|dead-url=}}</ref>
== Yachting == In 2009, Ewing entered the luxury yacht industry by acquiring the [[Ferretti Group]]'s 60% stake in Pinmar, the world's largest yacht painting company, and investing in YCO, a yacht chartering company.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.superyachttimes.com/yacht-news/the-ferretti-group-sells-its-entire-shareholding-in-pinmar-s-l/|title=The Ferretti Group sells its entire shareholding in Pinmar S.L. |website=SuperYacht Times |accessdate=2 November 2016}}</ref> In September 2012 Ewing launched an online platform for yacht charters called CharterBid.com.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.superyachts.com/news/mys-2012-sean-ewing-launches-charterbidcom-2041.htm|title=MYS 2012: Sean Ewing Launches Charterbid.com {{!}} superyachts.com|last=Superyachts.com|website=www.superyachts.com|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref> Ewing served as Chairman of Pinmar until its merger in September 2015 with Rolling Stock to form a new company, Global Yachting Group, (GYG).<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.pinmar.com/index.php/news-testimonials/news-article/global-yachting-group-press-release|title=Pinmar {{!}} Services for Superyachts & Yachts|website=www.pinmar.com|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref>
== Sport == Ewing was an avid golfer in his youth, participating in the Irish Amateur and British Amateur. He also played rugby for his County and captained the County team in Gaelic football. Ewing remains a strong amateur golfer, winning the Abu Dhabi Yas Links Senior Open in 2015 and the inaugural United Arab Emirates Golf Amateur Tour in the low handicap category in 2017.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://sport360.com/article/golf/uae-golf/36961/uae-golf-round-albertsons-eagle-clinches-nepal-charity-golf-day/|title=UAE golf round-up: Albertson’s eagle clinches Nepal Charity Golf Day|website=''sport360.com''|access-date=2 November 2016}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web|url=http://thesenioramateurtour.com/the-final-at-the-address-montgomerie-dubai/|title=The Final at The Address Montgomerie Dubai – The Senior Amateur Tour|website=''thesenioramateurtour.com''|access-date=6 October 2017}}</ref>

revision.comment: Rescuing 0 sources and tagging 1 as dead. #IABot (v1.6.5)
revision.text:
A '''protected slot limit''' is a tool used by [[Fishery|fisheries]] managers to regulate the size of [[fish]] that can legally be harvested from particular bodies of water. Usually set by state fish and game departments, the protected [[Slot limits|slot limit]] prohibits the harvest of fish where the [[fish measurement|lengths, measured]] from the [[snout]] to the end of the tail, fall within the protected interval.<ref>Minnesota Department of Natural Resources. “Minnesota Fishing Regulations 2011.” 2011. Print.</ref> For example, on a body of water where there is a protected slot limit on [[largemouth bass]] between 12 and 16 inches, largemouth between 12 inches and 16 inches may not be harvested.<ref>“Connecticut’s Bass Management Lakes”. PDF. Accessed 9/25/2011. URL: http://www.cr.gov/dep/lib/dep/fishing/freshwater/bassbroc.pdf{{dead link|date=May 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes }}</ref> In this example largemouth bass less than 12 inches and greater than 16 inches may be removed from the water and kept for personal use in accordance with local [[fishing]] regulations.
'''Slot limits''' are based on the principle that bass populations exhibit different habitat requirements during different phases of their life histories. Slot limits focus on protecting one segment of the life history which can influence overall fishing success.<ref name="autogenerated1">{{cite web|url=http://www.lsu.edu/seagrantfish/resources/factsheets/largemouthbass.htm |title=Louisiana Fisheries - Fact Sheets |publisher=Lsu.edu |date= |accessdate=2011-12-02}}</ref>
A [[minimum landing size]] is a similar regulation in other areas.
==Purpose== Generally, the purpose behind the implementation of protected slot limits is to improve the [[angling]] opportunities in a particular body or bodies of water. Protected slot limits are most often used to regulate the harvest from waters where natural reproduction of the concerned fish species occurs. The protected slot limit is set in such a way that it protects the size of those fish deemed most important to the species [[Spawn (biology)|spawning]] success in that fishery. With the size of the most sexually productive fish protected from harvest it is likely that an increased number will spawn during a given year and hence lead to more naturally produced individuals. The effort to increase the number of fish through natural reproduction mitigates the need for artificial stocking of a species to provide for a viable recreational fishery.
In addition to improving natural reproduction success the protected slot limit can also serve to improve the average catchable size of a [[protected species]]. This is of particular concern in recreational fisheries where the practice of [[catch and release]] is not prevalent. The slot limit protects those fish that evade harvest until their size exceeds that of the lower end of the protected slot. They are then protected from harvest until they exceed the maximum size within the protected slot. Fish within this size range are protected from harvest during the time when their size would make them desirable by anglers. In such a scenario the protection of large numbers of medium-sized fish translates into a higher success rate of those that exceed the slot limit.<ref>Pierce, Rodney. Tomcko, Cynthia. “Initial Effects of Slot Length Limits for Northern Pike in Five North-Central Minnesota Lakes.” 1997. Online report. PDF. Accessed 9/25/2011. URL: http://files.dnr.state.mn.us/publications/fisheries/investigational_reports/454.pdf</ref> Hence, the protected slot limit increases the amount of fish that reach the large sizes sought by [[Sport fishing|sport anglers]]. Of course, this model assumes that the lake or stream in question contains a forage base suitable to support fish of this size.
==Challenges== The issue of protected slot limits, in some cases, is marked in controversy. The protected slot limit and the angler’s desire to harvest fish can be in conflict. The main challenge lies in the economic, ecological, and social factors that fisheries managers must consider when implementing harvest regulations such as protected slot limits. Take, for example, the situation involving [[Lake Mille Lacs]] in central [[Minnesota]]. Anglers spend millions of dollars and travel countless miles to fish for Lake Mille Lacs [[walleye]] (Sander vitreus) which is highly sought after for its table fare as well as its sporting qualities. In the case of Lake Mille Lacs there has long been a protected slot limit for walleye. In 2002, the slot limit was from 20 inches to 28 inches. At the time, state fishing regulations stated that on Lake Mille Lacs an angler could keep 4 walleyes with only 1 walleye over 28 inches allowed, and all walleyes within the protected slot limit of 20 to 28 inches must be immediately released. The protected slot limit worked so well, in a sense, that anglers soon found it difficult to catch harvestable sizes of walleye and they were catching an overabundance of slot-sized fish. Many anglers have become frustrated by the lack of “eater” sized walleye. The intense protection of this size class of fish caused a sharp decline in the natural available forage base for walleyes.<ref>Sternberg, Dick. “The Mille Lacs Fish Management Plan: Threat to Minnesota’s Premier Walleye Fishery”. 2002. PDF. Accessed 9/25/2011. URL: http://www.perm.org/pdfs/TreatyManagement.pdf</ref> The result was a large number of unhealthy and underweight slot sized walleyes in the fishery. This case does represent an exception to the outcomes common to the implementation of protected slot limits. However, it does illustrate the objectives fisheries managers must consider when devising protected slot limits. Managers must balance the health of the fishery, trophy fish potential, and desired angler harvest.
==Ways to protect fish populations== When an [[angling|angler]] is [[fishing]], he or she must measure the fish caught to make sure it meets the state's wildlife and fisheries requirements. Every state has their own limits for fish that are native to their ecosystems. If the fish meets the requirements then the angler is allowed to keep the fish, but can only keep a certain amount of fish of that species. Besides a slot limit there are other ways and limits that officials can use to protect a fish population.
#Minimum size limits- important when higher levels of reproduction are required.<ref name="autogenerated1"/> #Creel Limits- used to prevent the harvest of too many fish at once, allowing more fish to reach larger sizes.<ref name="autogenerated1"/> [[Guist Creek Lake]] is an example of a lake that has decided that a creel limit was necessary for there native fish species. #Closed Seasons- used to help protect fish during their [[spawning]] seasons. If a given area puts a closed season into action an angler is not allowed to fish this area during specified times of the year.
==Mode of action== [[File:Large Mouth Bass growth.pdf|thumb|As a largemouth bass grows they must reach a certain size to enter the reproductive stage. These fish reproduce with more frequency during a certain age and weight in their lifespan.]] [[File:Largemouth Bass Slot Limit Diagram.pdf|thumb|The desired slot limit for largemouth bass]]
Before a slot limit can be put into action, four things must be taken into consideration in order to make sure no harm is done to the ecosystem:
===Growth rate=== Growth rate can be defined as how long it takes for a fish to reach a given size. Even though growth rate differs from lake to lake, an average [[largemouth bass]] can grow up to 3 pounds in less than three years, which is considered rapid growth.<ref name="bassresource1">{{cite web|url=http://www.bassresource.com/fish_biology/selective_harvest.html |title=Managing Bass Fisheries with Size Limits | The Ultimate Bass Fishing Resource Guide LLC |publisher=Bassresource.com |date= |accessdate=2011-12-02}}</ref>
===Recruitment=== [[Recruitment]] is defined as the number of young fish that live to adulthood. Lakes with 20 to 40% coverage of aquatic plants usually have high bass recruitment, whereas lakes with little shoreline cover often have low to intermediate recruitment.<ref name="bassresource1"/> If a lake has a high recruitment, this is a good situation for a state to use the slot limit because it will help control the number of small fish in a population. When the recruitment is low, this is where a state would use the minimum-size limit to control the fish population.<ref name="bassresource1"/>
===Mortality=== [[Mortality rate]] is the percent of fish in a given lake that die. To find the true mortality rate of a lake, officials must divide the number of fish harvested plus fish killed from hooks, then divide that number by the number of fish that die each year.
===Finally=== After the growth rate, recruitment rate, and mortality rate have been determined, if all three factors are met, the correct measurements must be chosen to insure that no harm is done to the surrounding ecosystem. If a slot limit is used correctly, not only will the a fish population benefit from this; but the surrounding ecosystem potentially could gain some benefits from a slot limit.
==Benefits== Slot limits can be very beneficial to fish species along with their ecosystem. One benefit from slot limits is that it reduces the amount of competitive pressure between fish the same size. Not only will it reduce competition, but it will also result in a healthier fish population since the slot limit doesn't allow anglers to keep fish that produce the most eggs during their spawning season. Since the fish are healthier and larger, this will bring more jobs and tourists to a town, which will result in the city's revenue to rise.
==Example of a slot limit== The [[Lake Fork Reservoir]] in Texas is known for its [[largemouth bass]]. A slot limit was introduced in the early 1900s in hopes of bettering the chances of catching a trophy bass. The regulations are:<ref>{{cite web|author=Richie White |url=http://www.bassfishing.org/LakeFork-BagLimits.htm |title=Lake Fork Bag Limits |publisher=Bassfishing.org |date= |accessdate=2011-12-04}}</ref> # Largemouth bass are subject to a 16- to 24-inch slot limit. # Bass 16 inches and shorter and 24 inches and longer can be harvest. # daily bag limit of 5 fish # 1 fish can be 24 inches or greater.
==References== {{reflist|32em}}
{{fishery science topics|expanded=management}}
[[Category:Fisheries law]]
